justification: Mentions B’s volatility preference but misapplies it to justify B giving up players they’d likely value. Overlooks B’s clear QB need and how Derek White fits, as well as A’s buy-low-on-injured tendency (Jordan Moore). The trade itself is plausible and roster-coherent: A gains a Tier 1 RB and an injured WR, B gains a dual-threat QB and a Tier 1 deep-threat WR. However, the rationale is generic, thin on evidence, and doesn’t separate A’s urgency from B’s playoff-positioned incentives.
